urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG
@CBlighty @EnvAgencySE There is an updated message coming out in the next few days
No wonder the river is in trouble @EnvAgency @timthefruit @EMorfett @HelenStace_HWT https://t.co/qp10kXXuQu

We use money from fishing rod licence fees to improve fish stocks and habitats across England.

So remember, a fishing licence isn't just a licence, it's something to be proud of!

Buy your new licence at: https://t.co/fx56eQ45pG https://t.co/tGvt3QeUAO

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids Shut it down!

@Tus_M_ @EnvAgencyMids 1st day of operation and 4 trucks are turned away, that‚Äôs 80 Tons of Welsh crap sent because it‚Äôs always been accepted before! Artic HGV‚Äôs are not cheap to operate, from Wales maybe ¬£300 each, no way did @RedIndustries2 tell them not to send illegal they got caught out!

@EnvAgencyMids Where do they check the loads?

I watched them and couldn‚Äôt see any evidence of checks. They offloaded to the pad and a digger was then filled and off it went.

@HelenVi00175623 @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock Weirdly it didn‚Äôt stay overnight, we must have been in a lucky pocket because it travelled onto Westbury Park and they had it inside some homes. Was it better for you Helen? You really needed a night off

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids So the gas flare will reduce odours will it like all the actions of the enforcement notice , two weeks later it‚Äôs worse than ever . You now see why we don‚Äôt trust you ? Follow the paper trail @EnvAgencyMids and close the wretched place down .

@SianieRoo @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice Well said @SianieRoo  @ClareDinnisEA  minimising the truth IT‚ÄôS NOXIOUS GAS that has an odour

@EnvAgencyMids To be crystal clear @ClareDinnisEA As if you didn‚Äôt know - this is NOT just an odour! Stop gaslighting the health effects from a toxic gas!! @Cap_it_off #stopthestink @StinkStopthe @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids And for how long were these lorries arriving and dumping without the EA there? How much in audited crap has gone into this stinking heap for how long?

@Feargal_Sharkey @defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency Well the actual source is actually us, the consumers, who are flushing or washing microplastics down our drains. Water companies are just one of the many pathways to the environment where we have an opportunity to try and capture it.

Why are @RedIndustries2 not being held accountable @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice ? Zero accountability & no financial penalties? Are they paying you off or are you really this cowardly? @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe #stopthestink @MattHancock https://t.co/cmMCxqNst5 https://t.co/LyUfxI5tYd

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP

Read our latest update to the situation at #WalleysQuarry #NewcastleUnderLyme here üëâ https://t.co/o558iAVicn 

A new gas flare we requested the operator to install was installed this week. It'll increase the amount of gas that can be collected & burnt off to help reduce odour. https://t.co/7KEj217PLA

More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time. Directly under the muck pile runs a drainage ditch that runs straight into the River Frome, which runs straight into the Lugg, which exceeds phosphate limits. @EnvAgency /1 https://t.co/IhAXZqe2gs

The @EnvAgency clearly doesn't have enough funds or boots on the ground to tackle this. Gov't needs to stump up, and polluters should pay. In the meantime, if you see muck pollution, please report it to the EA: 0800 807060. And share your photos. /4
@EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgencyMids these gas flares when are they going to start using them? ü§î
@EnvAgencyMids Basically whatever !No one believes either you or them anymore  .

@EnvAgencyMids Surely this suggests illegal loads have been tipping in there for years. Investigate it, prove it & shut down the operation. RED are not to be trusted with running this landfill! The only solution is to cap this place off! #stopthestink
@DrMickSalt @MPGeorgeEustice @BorisJohnson It really has reached crisis point now and cannot wait.

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA where should people from Silverdale go for fresh air I'm the nature,  should we all come to London? The air around here is toxic. @StinkStopthe #WalleysQuarry

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Tell them to visit Newcastle-under-Lyme and seen how much they connect with nature along with the stench of noxious gases from the landfill. They‚Äôll soon rush back from their lunch break to answer the many complaints from the community #StopTheStink

tweets.text: Ffs @BorisJohnson woke up with massive headache and can small gas in my house. Not the usual stink but an odourless gas. @PHE_uk @EnvAgency @EnvHealthNews what gases are these? Then tell me there are no long term health complications!! @MattHancock shut it down! @stopthestink

tweets.text:
@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Try going outside in Newcastle under Lyme.  

Deciding whether it is safe or not is mental torture.  

Get Walleys quarry landfill sorted out please?  

#StopTheStink

urls.title: Walleys Quarry campaigners call for permanent monitoring at landfill site
urls.description: The Environment Agency's four monitoring units are due to be removed in August

tweets.text: Report on my thoughts for continuous monitoring of Walleys Quarry Landfill to #StopTheStink permanently: https://t.co/qW1dFsHl3O

@StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @BorisJohnson @MattHancock this is how close these poor souls are to it ! You have to ensd this misery for them and everyone in Newcastle, Silverdale, Stoke ............ https://t.co/UBTZzXo4kA

tweets.text: @SimonLennane @EnvAgency @timthefruit @EMorfett @HelenStace_HWT The land is bleeding out & the rivers are dying.

@JamesBevanEA @samaritans This post doesn't mean a thing when there are thousands of people suffering not only physical health issues but mental health issues due to Walleys quarry ltd formerly known as @RedIndustries2 we are suffering.
#StopTheStink @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids
